Understate: The claim may be understating the potential impact of the Supreme Court decision by stating that any legislative action taken now "could very well be rendered completely null and void." The legal experts cited in the expert's verdict indicate that the passage of either Rhode Island bill would not be affected by a Supreme Court ruling.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support or evidence to back up the assertion that any legislative action taken now could be nullified by the Supreme Court decision.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Supreme Court decision will have the power to nullify any legislative action taken by the Rhode Island legislature, which is not supported by the legal experts' opinions.
Exist alternative explanation: The legal experts provide an alternative explanation by stating that the Supreme Court is only considering the constitutionality of bans on same-sex marriages, not the legality of same-sex marriage itself.
